claim: the solheim cup be host in the us on 7 occassions from 1990 through 2013
the united state team win 8 of the solheim cup start in 1990 and the last be in 2009
the solheim cup be host outside of the united state 6 time from 1990 - 2013
the highest score for a winning team be 18 and the lowest score be 11.5
patty sheehan , judy rankin , and kathy whitworth be all captain that win the cup 2 time
the solheim cup be host outside the us on 7 occasion from 1990 - 2013
the us last win the solheim cup in 2009 , which be 1 of 7 title since 1990
the solheim cup be host in the united state 6 time from 1990 - 2013
patty sheehan , judy rankin and kathy whitworth be all captain that win the solheim cup 1 time
resp:
For the claim to be true, there must be at least three captains (Patty Sheehan, Judy Rankin, and Kathy Whitworth) who have won the Solheim Cup exactly once.

Looking through the table we see that Patty Sheehan has won the cup twice, Judy Rankin has won it twice as well, while Kathy Whitworth has also won it at least twice. In fact, Judy Rankin has been captain four times and Kathy Whitworth has won the cup six times. So this claim is false.

However, there are a few captains who have won the Solheim Cup once: 

- 1998: judy rankin 
- 2003: patty sheehan 
- 2011: rosie jones 
- 1990: kathy whitworth

These three captains have all been captain once. Since they both won the solheim cup only once, "answer" is FALSE.

Here's the JSON response:

{
  "answer": "FALSE",
  "relevant_cells": [
    {"row_index": 1, "column_name": "winning team"},
    {"row_index": 4, "column_name": "winning team"},
    {"row_index": 6, "column_name": "winning team"}
  ]
}

claim: the highest score for a winning team be 18 , while the lowest score for a winning team be 13

function isTrue(data) {
  const claim = "the highest score for a winning team be 18 , while the lowest score for a winning team be 13";
  let max = data.data[0][3];
  let min = data.data[data.data.length - 1][3];

  function extractScores(row) {
    return row.slice(4, row.length).map(s => s.replace(/-/g, ''));
  }

  for (let i = 0; i < data.data.length; i++) {
    const scores = extractScores(data.data[i]);
    if (scores > max) {
      max = scores;
    }
    if (scores < min) {
      min = scores;
    }
  }

  return JSON.stringify({
    answer: claim.split('be ')[1].trim() === `18 - ${max}` && claim.split('be ')[0].trim() === `the lowest score for a winning team be` + `13`,
    relevant_cells: data.data.map((row, index) => ({
      row_index: index,
      column_name: 'score'
    }))
  });
}

console.log(isTrue(data));
